intro: Ononis azcaratei, commonly known as the Azcarate's sandwort, is a flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its low-growing habit and succulent stems. The plant produces small, white or pink flowers that bloom in spring, typically from April to June. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in coastal or semi-arid environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
